Contradict fact: The claim that two children in Guinea died after receiving a Covid-19 vaccine contradicts the fact that there were no reported fatalities among the children who fell sick after taking an anti-parasite drug.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources provided to verify the deaths of the children.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the deaths of the children were caused by the Covid-19 vaccine without any evidence or basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the children fell ill after receiving anti-parasite drugs as part of a national campaign in Guinea, which happened before the first case of Covid-19 was discovered.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by falsely attributing the deaths of the children to the Covid-19 vaccine, when there is no evidence to support this.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in this claim.
